page.title: 16STONE HOUSE HOTEL
page.content: The Stone House Hotel is situated on the A.34. It has been under new management since March 1984. It was previously named the Brooms Hotel the name which it has on the 1:25000 OS map. The hotel is registered with the English Tourist Board and the Heart of England Tourist Board. The A.A. have awarded a three star classification. To gain this each room must be equiped with a colour television and a telephone. They have also earned a bedroom category of 5. They employ 21 people, 6 full time and 15 part time. There is a dining room which seats 50 and the hotel can accomodate 33 people in the 17 rooms. There is a meeting place which seats 2-35 people.
